programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Vegas won its last five meetings with Minnesota after taking all three this season, including a 5-1 win in the last matchup on March 25 behind a hat trick from Jack Eichel, the fifth of his career and first since 2023, and 23 saves from Adin Hill.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Washington won two of its three regular-season meetings with Montreal, including a 6-3 win at home back on Oct. 31 behind a goal and two assists from career NHL goal leader Alex Ovechkin, along with two points from Aliaksei Protas and Tom Wilson.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: UFC The Walk
programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: Detailed analysis of coaching strategies for upcoming games in the National Football League; experts use the coaches' film to illustrate effective and ineffective strategies for the various matchups and provide an in-depth breakdown of potential game

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Dylan Cease (1-1, 6.64) has allowed 24 hits in 20.1 innings for San Diego; Framber Valdez (1-2, 4.91) of Houston gave up seven runs on 10 hits in four innings at St. Louis.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: John Elway, Todd Blackledge, Jim Kelly, Tony Eason, Ken O'Brien and Dan Marino were the six quarterbacks selected in the first round of the 1983 NFL Draft, and three of those players went on to craft Hall of Fame careers in the NFL.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Peyton Manning entered the 1997 season as the Heisman favorite after announcing his return to Tennessee, but other names including Charles Woodson, Ryan Leaf and Randy Moss would make it one of the most memorable runs for the prestigious award.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Winnipeg gained an early 1-0 series lead after a 5-3 win over St. Louis in Game 1 behind a goal and two assists from both Kyle Connor and Mark Scheifele, along with two assists from Josh Morrissey; Jordan Kyrou scored for the Blues in the loss.

programme.title: The 129th Boston Marathon
programme.desc: Ethiopia's Sisay Lemma finished with a time of 2:06:17 to defeat countryman Mohamed Esa by 41 seconds, while two-time defending champion Evans Chebet finished third; Hellen Obiri of Kenya won the women's title for the second-straight year.

programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.desc: ESPN's NFL Nation reporters make picks for the team they cover in this unique version of a mock draft, as draft gurus share their analysis on each of the picks and how the selection projects for the respective team going into the future.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Los Angeles won three of its four season meetings with Edmonton, including a 5-0 victory on April 14 behind a combined 21 saves from Darcy Kuemper and David Rittich, but the Oilers eliminated the Kings in the first round of the 2024 playoffs.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst and a group of ESPN insiders cover anything and everything from around the NBA, breaking down the latest stories making headlines, recapping and previewing marquee matchups, and interviewing guests to gather their thoughts.

programme.title: La Liga
programme.desc: Coverage of top-tier soccer from Spain.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Hawthorn (4-1-0) suffered its first defeat of 2025 after falling to Port Adelaide, 121-91, on April 13; Geelong (3-2-0) has won five of the past six encounters against the Hawks, including a 110-59 triumph last season in Round 17.

programme.title: Culture of Winning: Polynesian Football Pride
programme.desc: A look at the success of Polynesian NFL players and the impact their sports success has back on their communities; Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa will be joined by Penei Sewell, Puka Nacua, Jonah Savaiinaea and Chris Henry Jr.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Culture of Winning: Polynesian Football Pride
programme.desc: A look at the success of Polynesian NFL players and the impact their sports success has back on their communities; Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa will be joined by Penei Sewell, Puka Nacua, Jonah Savaiinaea and Chris Henry Jr.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Memphis (0-3) is in search of its first win this season after an 18-17 loss to Houston; Michigan (2-1) won its first season meeting with the Showboats, 26-12, on March 30 behind 163 passing yards and two total touchdowns from Bryce Perkins.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Chandler Smith secured his first Truck Series win of the season and first since Richmond in 2022 with a victory at Bristol over Kyle Larson, who won the last Truck Series race at Rockingham back in 2013, beating Joey Logano by 0.177 seconds.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: San Diego won the season series with the Tigers last year, winning two of three games Petco Park.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL champion San Antonio (0-3) is in search of its first win after a 26-23 loss to Michigan despite Kellen Mond; DC (3-0) stayed undefeated with a 27-15 win over St. Louis behind three passing touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (2-1) won two straight since falling to DC, 18-11, beating Arlington, 10-9, on April 11 behind Matt Corral; Houston (1-2) ended its two-game skid with an 18-17 win over Memphis behind Nolan Henderson.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Postgame
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent game with highlights and interviews with players and managers, along with looking around the rest of the MLB to update games in progress and show highlights of the completed games to cover the day's action.

programme.title: Culture of Winning: Polynesian Football Pride
programme.desc: A look at the success of Polynesian NFL players and the impact their sports success has back on their communities; Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa will be joined by Penei Sewell, Puka Nacua, Jonah Savaiinaea and Chris Henry Jr.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: UFL Football

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Nimble, a mixed-breed dog, won in 2024.
